reviewText: This video consists of two 20 minute workout sessions. The first one is low-impact and the second is medium-impact circuit training with weights.I recommend skipping the first session. It's not choreographed well at all; in fact, I think Denise was making up the steps as she went along. Also, it's boring and repetitive.The second session is the one I love. (It's amazing how two sessions on the same tape by the same instructor can be so different!)  I've been using it a few times a week for a few years now and I never get sick of it. It is well choreographed. The steps are easy to follow once you do it a few times. It's just the right amount of aerobics and light weights. The music is, suprisingly, not that annoying. I always work up a sweat when I do this workout. After a couple of weeks of doing it, I definitely noticed a difference in my arms and legs in terms of toning. This is a perfect little workout and I highly recommend it.
summary: Ignore the first part, do the second instead
Title: N/A

reviewText: This workout is excellent for beginners and people who have problems with their knees, like myself. It helped me to move on to more challenging videos. Denise Austin is encouraging, if not a little bit cheesy.  However, if you can put up with this you will get an excellent workout. I started out alternating between the two workouts and quickly advanced to doing both workouts back to back. The first workout can get old pretty quick because it is repetitive but the second workout is fun and seems to time seems to fly by when you are doing it. I highly recommend this video.
summary: Excellent workout to begin a fitness regimen!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Ok to start out with i love Densie Austin she is my favorite workout instructor but this tape was very boring and the music was not fun or energetic at all. I found it to be issuficiant for getting your heart rate up and yes i was sweating but i was well aware that my heart rate was very low and i felt like i was not doing enough work, To be fair i havent tried the interval workout but i plan on giving it a try but based on the arobic workout this is not i good tape for a person who excersies on a regular basis. I just stoped five minutes before the workout ended not because i was tired but because i was so bored!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Denise Austin is very nice and fun to watch, and it is in a great beach setting, but her steps are soooo COMPLICATED, you need to be a dancer to do them. I have been doing FIRM workouts for years, and I don't get discombobulated very easy, but I felt like I was tripping over my own feet ("Okay, grapevine, boxstep, mambo, turn and jump!"). I almost landed on my head, and the funny thing is, she even trips over HER feet when she is doing it (Watch carefully...you'll see her stumble). How does she expect us to do it???She seems really nice, really. But I can't reccommend this video.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I found the first workout on this video to be a bit dull and not a very hard workout.  The second workout, however, is fantastic!  If you have a short attention span, like I do, and want to get a great workout in 30 minutes, this is the one for you.  I even find myself daydreaming about it at work.  Great job, Denise!

reviewText: I bought this ages ago and I like it a lot.  Good workout.  It's two workouts and I like both.  Outdoor scenery is nice too.

reviewText: I just recently started a small fitness video collection to help me keep fit and tone up.  I already own Denise Austin's "Hit the Spot: Thighs", and am waiting to receive "Hit the Spot: Arms and Bust; Abs; Buns", which I recently ordered.Personally, I am not into aerobics, as I prefer walking and swimming.  Whenever I go to the gym, I never partake in any aerobics classes, as I am not a `jump-around' person.I read in one of my health books that it is important to incorporate a cardio workout besides toning the body.  Therefore, I decided to get one cardio fitness video, featuring Denise Austin, as I enjoy her chatty persona.  I decided on  "Hit the Spot: Fat Burning Blast" after having read many of the customer reviews about it on Amazon.com."Hit the Spot: Fat Burning Blast" has two 20-minute workouts that are intense and a lot of fun.  The first half with Denise alone doing a low-impact workout is good.  I broke out into a sweat, and had to dry off and wait a little before starting the second portion.The second half of the video (the `Circuit') portion is better, and more fun as it involves Denise and two other fitness trainers, Matthias (who is a gorgeous, muscled hunk!) and Caroline assisting her.  It involves aerobics with brief intervals involving toning up with weights for 1 minute.  By the end of the tape, I was sore, and drenched in sweat.Generally, the whole video is good!  The outdoor `beach' settings are nice, and the music is great.  In the 'Circuit' portion, I love the musical interludes where Denise, Matthias and Caroline do their body sculpting before getting back to the aerobics.  Denise's perkiness is in prime form in "Fat Burning Blast".  Many people often complain about Denise Austin's chatty style in her videos.  But I think her chattiness and perkiness is a big help in motivating us to tone up and keep fit, and makes the workouts enjoyable.In conclusion, "Hit the Spot: Fat Burning Blast" will be my only cardio fitness video.  I don't want any other, but this one!  It is sufficient, plus it is effective and a lot of fun!
Title: N/A
